Activity: Log in to the system, check emails. Confirm meeting details with @CLINLEAD-1 and @PCHMP-1. Review the meeting agenda.
Attend meeting with @CLINLEAD-1 and @PCHMP-1. Gather requirements and feedback on the report template's content, format, and intended audience. Take detailed notes.
Update the report template outline based on the feedback received from the meeting. Prioritize the inclusion of information that is most relevant to clinical decision-making and hospital operations.
Draft the 'Executive Summary' and 'Introduction' sections of the report template. Clearly state the purpose of the report, the key findings, and the implications for public health.
Lunch Break. Check out the top news in the world.
Refine the design specifications for the data visualizations based on the feedback received. Ensure that the visualizations are clear, concise, and effectively communicate the key findings.

Contact @QATEST-1 and @QATEST-2 via email to schedule time to consult on the usability and accessibility of the report template for different users. Topic: Feedback on Report Template Usability and Accessibility
Draft the 'Conclusion' and 'Recommendations' sections of the report template. Summarize the key findings and provide actionable recommendations for public health agencies and healthcare providers.
Review the report template and update the summary.
